text: These are lists of the busiest airports in the United States. Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport is the busiest single airport in the United States. However, all of the New York City metropolitan area's airports combine to create the largest airport system in the United States. They are also second in the world in terms of passenger traffic, and first in the world in terms of total flight operations. ==50 busiest US airports by total passenger boardings== Rank (2010) Airport IATA Code City Served State 2010CY 2010 Enplanements at Primary Airports 2009CY 2009 Passenger Boarding and All-Cargo Data 2008 2007Federal Aviation Administration 2007 passenger boarding statistics 2006Federal Aviation Administration 2006 passenger boarding statistics 2005Federal Aviation Administration 2005 passenger boarding statistics 1 Hartsfield Jackson Atlanta International Airport ATL Atlanta GA 43,130,585 42,280,868 43,236,665 43,236,665 41,352,038 42,402,653 2 O'Hare International Airport ORD Chicago IL 32,171,831 31,135,732 33,683,991 36,521,585 36,825,097 36,720,005 3 Los Angeles International Airport LAX Los Angeles CA 28,857,755 27,439,897 28,861,477 30,113,985 29,357,327 29,372,272 4 Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport DFW Dallas/Fort Worth TX 27,100,656 26,663,984 27,219,985 28,482,417 28,627,749 28,079,147 5 Denver International Airport DEN Denver CO 25,241,962 24,013,669 24,287,939 20,796,173 20,591,909 20,315,544 6 John F.
